file_content.text: If you ever need something exploded, turn to Zyman.
Ha! I'd recognize the sound of my own bombs at almost any distance. And was that the sound of a rocket tram crashing I just heard? Sounds like success.
You have my sincerest gratitude. Here. Take one of my smaller explosives. You never know when it might come in handy.
The rocket tram must be stopped. Or it's my life, I'm afraid.
Hunter. I can tell you're the best. You know how I know? You work for the Empire, and they only hire the best.
My lord. It is terrifying to make your acquaintance.
Sir! Long live the Emperor! May the Empire conquer the whole galaxy!
Ah! Friend of the Empire! Long live the Empire!
Name's Zyman, but you can pick what you call me. "Zyman," or "you," or "alien scum." Don't worry, I'm used to it.
The Empire needs things exploded, and no one makes stuff go boom like Kapp Zyman. Though, it'd help if the Republic didn't fight back so hard.
What's the problem?
I can handle the Republic.
I'd be truly indebted.
You talk big, bomb-builder.
You've heard of the third continent of Zarak-Nine? Created by one of my bombs, sunk into a fault line and detonated.
The Republic's using the rocket tram's green line to run fresh troops and supplies across Coronet City. The Empire wants that tram derailed.
I've got the bombs built, but no way of getting to the tracks and setting them up. The Republic's got squads and snipers patrolling the entire line.
Hasn't the Empire supplied you with any troops for the job?
You could use some soldiers.
They did. They all died. When I requested more, they said something about "the stupidity of hiring an alien to get a job done."
Then they said something about "Blow up that tram, even if you have to blow yourself up to do it."
Hope you'll pardon my rudeness in asking, but I like living. And I'm sure someone like you could destroy those tracks in no time.
All right. Enough guilt-trip.
You're right.
Not really. [Refuse quest]
I can plant the bombs.
Thank you. Truly, I'm indebted to you. Here. Take the bombs and let me know when the job's done.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Well, it was worth a shot.
Hmm. Perhaps if we place the bombs here... no, who am I kidding. That will never work.
